bug.author: tdenimal
bug.summary: Wavenet : cannot change default activation function - Gluonts 0.3.3
bug.description:
Hello, It seems that there is an error, in Gluonts 0.3.3, when you change the default activation function (ELU) for the WAVENET estimator, for example by relu
estimator = WaveNetEstimator( freq = "1W", dilation_depth = 4, train_window_length = 20, prediction_length = 10, act_type="relu") estimator.train(train)
Results in the following exception :
TypeError Traceback (most recent call last) in ----> 1 estimator.train(train) ~/anaconda3/envs/gluonts/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gluonts/model/wavenet/_estimator.py in train(self, training_data) 294 params = self._get_wavenet_args(bin_centers) 295 params.update(pred_length=pred_length) --> 296 trained_net = WaveNet(**params) 297 298 self.trainer(
~/anaconda3/envs/gluonts/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gluonts/model/wavenet/_network.py in init(self, bin_values, n_residue, n_skip, dilation_depth, n_stacks, act_type, cardinality, embedding_dimension, pred_length, **kwargs) 192 nn.ELU() 193 if act_type == "elu" --> 194 else nn.Activation(act_type=act_type) 195 ) 196 self.cross_entropy_loss = gluon.loss.SoftmaxCrossEntropyLoss() TypeError: init() missing 1 required positional argument: 'activation'
Seems that the correct syntax should be : nn.Activation(activation=act_type) See <denchmark-link:http://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/versions/1.4.1/api/python/gluon/nn.html#mxnet.gluon.nn.Activation>http://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/versions/1.4.1/api/python/gluon/nn.html#mxnet.gluon.nn.Activation</denchmark-link>
It seems to work when you change the syntax that way. Best regards,

comments.comment: Thanks. This is indeed a bug. Could you perhaps send a PR for that?
